title: Congratulating Mepham High School student-athlete Christopher Shevins upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Golden Eleven Scholarship
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION congratulating Mepham High School student-athlete
Christopher Shevins upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of
the  Golden Eleven Scholarship Award by the Nassau County Chapter of the
National Football Foundation

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to act, in accord with
its long-standing traditions, honoring the youth of today,  and  leaders
of  tomorrow, whose character and achievements best exemplify the ideals
and values cherished by this great State and Nation; and
  WHEREAS, Athletic competition enhances the moral and physical develop-
ment of the young people of this State, preparing them for the future by
instilling in them the value of  teamwork,  encouraging  a  standard  of
healthy living, imparting a desire for success and developing a sense of
fair play and competition; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to  congratu-
late  Mepham  High  School  student-athlete Christopher Shevins upon the
occasion of his designation as recipient of the Golden  Eleven  Scholar-
ship Award by the Nassau County Chapter of the National Football Founda-
tion; and
  WHEREAS,  This special event was held at the Crest Hollow Country Club
in Woodbury, New York, on December 1, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, The Golden Eleven Scholarship Award considers all aspects  of
the  student's achievement, including athletic participation, academics,
as well as community service; this prestigious award is given to the  11
players who best embody the behavior expected of student-athletes on and
off the field; and
  WHEREAS,  Christopher  Shevins, age 17 of North Merrick, New York, was
selected by the National Football Foundation as one of  Nassau  County's
Golden  Eleven when his football coach, Anthony Cracco wrote a letter to
the foundation listing his impressive academic and athletic  accomplish-
ments; and
  WHEREAS, Described by his teachers and coaches as a model student-ath-
lete and a true leader, Christopher Shevins is being recognized for this
award  as  a reflection of his hard work in the classroom, on the field,
as well as within his community; and
  WHEREAS, A member of the football, lacrosse and  basketball  teams  at
Mepham  High  School,  Christopher  Shevins maintained a 3.9 grade point
average while playing a pivotal role in numerous clubs and activities at
the school; in addition, he was named All-County in  football  and  All-
Conference in lacrosse; and
  WHEREAS,  Christopher  Shevins  is  an active member of numerous honor
societies, including National, Art, Social Studies, English and Spanish;
a proud member of Athletes Helping Athletes and the  Students  Athletics
Leadership  Team,  he has also given generously of his time volunteering
for the Rockville Centre Youth Lacrosse  Clinic,  the  Police  Athletics
League  Youth  Lacrosse  Program, and the Lupus Walk at Eisenhower Park;
and
  WHEREAS, Furthermore, Christopher Shevins was the proud  recipient  of
the  Roy  Kessenich  Memorial  Scholarship  Award,  another  honor  that
requires academic and athletic success; and
  WHEREAS, Christopher Shevins's overall record is outstanding;  he  was
loyally  and enthusiastically supported by family, fans, friends and the
community at large; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the values of teamwork, pride and
accomplishment, and Christopher Shevins has clearly made a  contribution
to the spirit of excellence which is a tradition of his school; and

  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and pay
tribute  to  those  young  people  within  the State of New York who, by
achieving outstanding success in athletics as well  as  academics,  have
inspired  and  brought  pride to their school and community; now, there-
fore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Mepham High School student-athlete Christopher Shevins upon
the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Golden Eleven Schol-
arship Award by the Nassau County Chapter of the National Football Foun-
dation; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Christopher Shevins.
